item.title: A Debugging Analysis: When Chrome Extension Storage Events Don't Propagate
item.description: TL;DR This article documents a case study in Chrome extension development where chrome.storage.onChanged events failed to propagate from background service workers to options pages, preventing UI updates. Through systematic debugging, I identified a cross-context communication edge case and implemented a hybrid event-polling solution. While Chrome’s official documentation presents storage events as reliable, this analysis suggests defensive programming practices are essential for critical state synchronization. Introduction During the development of a Chrome extension requiring synchronization between background service workers and options page UI, I encountered a subtle but critical issue: storage events silently failed to notify the options page of state changes, despite the data being successfully written to chrome.
